name: Pueblo Bonito Pacifica Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stop on our 3 week adventure through Mexico and what a wonderful start it gave us. The hotel is approximately a 40 minute drive from the San Jose del Cabo airport, the drive gives you a good chance to see some of what Los Cabos has to offer. I would recommend having your transfer to the hotel booked prior to your arrival, and like other reviewers mention beware of the Time Share gauntlet. We had basically been conned in to going to a presentation before we even knew what was going on!!! We attended a time share presentation at the Grand Mayan which was an absolutely horrible experience – if there is one that you try your hardest to avoid make it this one!!
reviews.title: Loved the Pacifica and ít's staff

likes.liked: — Staff, size, design, spa ... I could go on!!
likes.disliked: — Leaky shower door ... honestly that's all I can think of!!

reviews.title: Relaxing and pretty, but bad food
reviews.text: On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by smiling staff and from that moment on we felt welcome and were well looked after!! Check-in was quick, after which you are sent to another desk where you can opt to partake in the properties time share pitch, as we had already committed to one we didn’t want to waste any more of our precious holiday time so we declined, our response was accepted straight away and we weren’t hassled for the remainder of our stay.

We were shown to our room by a lovely staff member (I only wish I could remember his name), he put up with our attempts to speak Spanish and was interested in learning something about Australia and where we were travelling to. He showed us all the features of the room, the hotel and told us about the shuttles to their sister hotels.
reviews.title: All the details about Pacifica - Great Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Not enugh info on their website.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a late lunch in the restaurant, Siempre, and also breakfast there one day both were very nice but a little pricey and took a while for the meals to arrive, staff were once agian great. We ate at the poolside area, Aire, on a few occasions and the food was always great and reasonably priced, Carlos looked after us making sure we never had an empty glass or went hungry. We also had lunch at the deli / café which again was good quality, served with a smile and reasonable priced. We did take advantage of the free shuttle service and went next door to the Sunset property for dinner one night. This is a massive property hence doesn’t have the same atmosphere as the Pacifica, it was very busy and a lot louder and staff were unable to pay you the kind of attention they do at the smaller Pacifica. Despite this the food was very good and we met one of the staff, the delightful Jesus, out the front of the lobby when waiting for the return shuttle.
reviews.title: Great Service
Best Weather Ever!
reviews.text: The Pacifica is so relaxing, beautifully landscaped in a minimalistic style and kept so clean!! The heated jacuzzi was great for a realaxing swim on the cool nights. The beach is pretty and although you can’t swim it’s lovely to go for a walk and watch the sunset and the waves crash in!! Baby turtles actually hatched on the beach the night of our arrival, it was nice watching them find their way to the water to begin their lives. More on relaxing – the spa is heaven!! I had the best neck, back and shoulders massage I've had anywhere in the world. The facility offers you access to showers (complete with shampoo etc), a hot and cold tub and sauna. Staff are wonderful and the area is clean, well maintained and the treatments are reasonably priced!!

I have just come back from a 1 week stay in this resort, and it was absolute Heaven! The absence of both cigarette smoke and children made it a really relaxing time, and I can't recommend it highly enough. The resort is so clean, and the staff so friendly and helpful - it's one of those places where they bother to remember your name, and every day they seem pleased to see you. Most of our time was spent around the pool, and it was just beautiful. We had just come from a week in Las vegas, so it was somewhat moving from the ridiculous to the sublime, and it was a perfect way to finish off our trip. I can't say we had any problems at all - and despite what other reviewers have written, I didn't find the food at all expensive, and it was really good quality. Another benfit of the Pacifica is the size - it's tiny compared to the other huge resorts in Los Cabos, so you really feel as if the focus is on you, and ensuring you have the best stay possible. I can't wait to go back!!
reviews.title: Just Heaven!

We witnessed many staff members cleaning and grooming the grounds throughout our stay and overall the property is beautifully kept and in a gorgeous setting at the bottom of a mountain right on the Pacific.

reviews.title: Peaceful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a relaxing vacation then the Pacifica is the place for you. It was my first time in Cabo, my g/f 3rd time. She has stayed at Las Ventanas and The One and Only before. She liked the Pacifica over both of them. It really truely is a peaceful restort. From the moment you walk into the tranquil lobby to when u exit the lobby to the incredible view. We had booked the 1 room suite and luckily got the 5th floor which is the highest. Loved the room but loved the balcony even more. The beds (2 queens) were very comfortable and they even have a 'pillow' menu for you to choose from about 5 different pillows for your comfort. The bathroom was very spacious and very well decorated/designed. The only problems I had with the room was the furntiure didnt appear to fit the room. The coffee table was too large to fit between the couch and the TV stand and the night table between the beds was the exact height as the light/fan switches. We did have an issue with ants, which I thought was very odd being on the 5th floor, but the problem was taken care of. The entire hotel and grounds were extremely clean and well taken care of. Lots of staff on hand everywhere. They have a full day of 'activities' set up ranging from towel folding (which was fun) to horseshoes, darts and ping pong. So we did decide to do the timeshare presentation as the lady promised $200 in food credit and $100 spa. The Pueblo Bonita Sunset is just up the hill and where the timeshares are and it turned out to be a sour experience. Property appears nice on the tour but then when it came to 'sell' time the guy Mike turned extremely rude when we stated we wanted to research it more or to run the numbers better. He go so rude we just got up and left and didnt even get our vouchers, wasnt worth the hassle. Then on our 3rd day we went to the Sunset (you can use all the Pueblo Bonita's properties) we were extremely unimpressed by the service and the need wait for the golf carts to go anywhere. The Pacifica is head and shoulders above the Sunset. Only problem is a lack of places to eat at the Pacifica but you can take a free shuttle to town or to Sunset to eat. We both would go back to the Pacifica again as it was a 10 out of 10 for a very relaxing vacation.
reviews.title: The perfect getaway

reviews.text: I stayed here for 5 days two years ago. The hotel is lovely and it has it own private beach. I loved the lavender scent. It was very relaxing and rejuvenating. My biggest complaint was they charged me $12 for a Coke and a Red Bull from the mini bar. I never took anything out of the mini bar. I did not give myself enough time to check out and could not dispute the charges in person. I told them I did not take anything from the mini bar. They never responded to my email. It was not worth my time to fight it. I will not return and would not recommend it to my friends for this reason.
reviews.title: Got charged $12 for a Coke and Red Bull I did not take

likes.disliked: — The prices - but at a certain point you just have to turn the other way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was spot on from past reviews I had read - the time share sharks at the aiport, the 45 minute van ride from the airport to the hotel, the wonderful lavender smell of the lobby as you walked up (by the way, you can actually buy the spray that makes the lobby smell so good, down in their spa - it's pure lavender and comes in a large bottle with an extra spray nozzle attachment, for $37. They had a smaller bottle too - I think for $16.) - and the nice, cold, lavender infused towels that they handed to you. Yes, we were hustled straight from checking in, directly to the time share ladies - but we were prepared for this, and made sure we signed up for all the goodies we wanted, upfront.
reviews.title: Very Peaceful and Beautiful

likes.liked: — the service and the relaxing atmosphere
likes.disliked: — too far from town and no swimming in ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room - even though I requested a higher floor - ended up on the first floor...which turned out to be just fine (from the front side it was floor one, and from the side that faces the beach, it was floor 2). We had a lovely view of the pool, Siempre (their restaurant), and the beach. The room was exactly as the pictures showed - so we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: The good, the bad and the ugly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did sit through the "90" minute time share presentation the very next day - which ended up being 4.5 hours instead. This is held at their sister property the Sunset - which is only about an 8 minute van ride up the hill. We were very interested in what they had to offer - and went down on our trip, with that mindset. We held off until the very end - as the offers kept getting better, and we got exactly what we wanted, and what we were expecting to pay. We feel very good about this purchase, as the PB hotel chain is directly partnered with the Ritz Carlton - and their new resort is planned to go in, right next door to the Pacifica (which will have 2 Jack Nicklaus golf courses included).
reviews.title: Spend your money elsewhere

likes.disliked: — flies, close proximity to bad area, corruption

aka: Pueblo Bonito Pacifica Resort And Spa
description: The award-winning Pueblo Bonito Pacifica Resort & Spa is an enchanting oasis of natural beauty and relaxation, located on a 2.5 mile stretch of pristine white beach on the Pacific Ocean, just one mile from lively downtown Cabo San Lucas. This boutique resort offers Luxury without Limitations, a deluxe all-inclusive plan providing gourmet a la carte dining, enhanced guest services and a wide range of amenities. Pacifica features five restaurants, five bars, two pools, an award-winning spa and luxurious accommodations in a calm, adults-only environment. Fashionably decorated guestrooms and suites include furnished patios and balconies with stunning views of the ocean and sunsets . Designed for the sophisticated and discerning guest, Pueblo Bonito Pacifica has everything needed for a fun and relaxing vacation experience.
